title: How many universities in New Zealand have international programs for foreign students? - Quora
tags: Universities and Colleges in New Zealand

response.answer_text: Thanks for the A2A. New Zealand’s universities, polytechnics, and private training establishments have for several years targeted the international market. International students are regarded as cash cows who are charged higher rates of tuition fees than domestic students. Many New Zealand tertiary institutions and several high schools have English as a Second Language (ESOL) programme targeting international students. A large number of them come from Asian countries like China, Malaysia, India, Indonesia, and the Philippines. New Zealand has eight public universities.[1] All have international students departments, ESOL programmes, and social clubs and societies for international students. There are some scholarships available for international students but there is a lot of competition for them.[2] Most courses are aimed at both domestic and international students apart from the ESOL programmes. I would recommend visiting each of their websites for yourself. I have no idea of what program you are planning to enrol it but it’s best to do your own research. Wish you all the best. Footnotes[1] Introducing NZ’s eight universities[2] Scholarships for international students
